comment.text: Involved in pyrimidine base degradation. Catalyzes the reduction of uracil and thymine. Also involved the degradation of the chemotherapeutic drug 5-fluorouracil.
Binds 4 [4Fe-4S] clusters. Contains approximately 16 iron atoms per subunit.
Found in most tissues with greatest activity found in liver and peripheral blood mononuclear cells.

disease.name: Dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase deficiency
disease.description: A metabolic disorder with large phenotypic variability, ranging from no symptoms to a convulsive disorder with motor and mental retardation. It is characterized by persistent urinary excretion of excessive amounts of uracil, thymine and 5-hydroxymethyluracil. Patients suffering from this disease show a severe reaction to the anticancer drug 5-fluorouracil.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase family.

feature.description: FAD; via amide nitrogen and carbonyl oxygen
In DPYDD; allele DPYD*9A and allele DPYD*9B; loss of activity; dbSNP:rs1801265.
In DPYDD; allele DPYD*8; loss of activity; dbSNP:rs1801266.
In DPYDD; allele DPYD*9B; 25% of activity; dbSNP:rs1801267.
In allele DPYD*10; low activity; dbSNP:rs1801268.
